reviews.review_msg: I had Justin Gray for my Differential Equations course and I enjoyed his teaching, definitely above average from what i've come to expect from math professors. From an unbiased outsider's perspective, there can be a lot of lectures and the weekly assignments can be tough. But like all math courses, if you put the work in you will get rewarded well.
Clear pre-recorded lectures with an option to attend "flipped" classes. Weekly quizzes are taken straight from non-graded weekly assignments. Fair midterm.

Despite class being really hard, his explanation in pre-recorded lectures was clear and to the point. Quite honestly a very good prof. The only minor criticism that comes to mind is the structure of office hours/tutorials.
Amazing short and concise lectures. To the point. Tests were fair, class is pretty difficult but overall Justin teaches wel.
Avoid if possible, boring lecture, late lectures

Justin's running of the class literally a joke. He was moving to a new place so the few lectures had no teaching component, whatsoever, the canvas page is not updated. He are still stuck at first lecture meanwhile the other section class has finished two chapters. Avoid him.

Dr. singh tries to be a good prof, but he just isn't a good lecturer. His lectures are very scattered, and difficult to follow because a lot of the time he would accidentally skip something and goes back and talks about it. Poor organization of the course, very little communication. I've done very well on the course, but everything was self learned

I really enjoyed his class. The material was (for the most part) delivered very clearly and it is very easy to ask him questions in office hours if there is something you dont understand. He even made a class discord before the final so we could ask any last minute questions. Super great guy who wants you to learn as long as you are willing to try

Definitely go to the lectures as much as you can. He made the content interesting and provided enough background to each topic without it being too unnecessary. The course material is difficult itself but if you do the assignments and review the sample exams he provides you should be good.  Deserves a higher rating here lol

Ben was a great prof. He was always available and non-judgmental during office hours. Very open and friendly. The class itself was honestly not too bad compared to some other 200-level math classes I have taken.

His course meets my expectation of 200 level math, 2nd midterm was lit bit hard for 50 mins but final was pretty fair, quiz slightly harder than the hw but style is pretty similar. His lecture is def not that bad, both Leo and Hannah were really helpful during tutorial

how can someone so mean have such a cute dog :(

first midterm was fair and easy to study for which then gave us a false sense of security for the second midterm. average went from 70 on the first one to 44 on the second one lol. final was somewhere in the middle but overall that second midterm and the quizzes afterward were way too hard.

I had Tom for MATH 260: Introduction To Differential Equations and he was a great prof. He is very clear on what will be tested for the midterms and has interactive lecture notes and Participation Quizzes in tutorials (forces you to go). Besides that, he tries his best to make the content interesting relating it to real-life situations when viable.

His synchronous class as stated turned into only office hours and recorded videos. His recorded videos were hard to understand due to his handwriting. Didn't answer questions that well during office hour. Recommend to take this class only if you're willing to look for other videos to understand material
easy exams

Pyke definitely isn't as bad as people make him out to be. He is an ok lecturer, sometimes boring but gets the general point across. He makes some mistakes in lectures which can make them hard to follow but he also asks questions to keep the audience engaged. Quizzes were often difficult but exams were straightforward if you remember all the method

Worst professor! Do not take any courses with him or you will regret. His accent so difficult to understand and his writing so messy during the lecture. There are many other math professors way better than him. AVOID!!

Lectures were really clear and he provided skeleton notes that made it easy to follow along. Exams were quite fair, though the final was very long (but very similar to the practice). As long as you put in plenty of practice and do all the HW you should do fine
Hard to understand and doesnt care about what hes teaching...

He came across as pretty stern, but he's actually very caring and willing to help. His quizzes and exams are all VERY fair and he tells you exactly what to expect in class. For the exams, go over his review guide and practice tests (which he provides), the questions on the actual exam are nearly identical.

easily the best math prof I've ever had. there is a reason the lecture hall is almost always is full. he is strict, but definitely respected. just go to every class and you'll understand the content. stephen has such a good way of explaining the content that I don't have to rely on youtube videos to learn
